item.title: Celine Dion's Illness Leading to Postponement of Two Shows Not Related to Coronavirus
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The 'My Heart Will Go On' hitmaker, as explained in a statement, started to suffer from the 'symptoms of a common cold' on March 9 after completing a six-show run in the New York area.

item.title: Coachella Fires Back at Elon Musk for Dissing Festival Following Postponement Announcement
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The criticism doesn't go unnoticed by the festival which quickly claps back at the Tesla founder with many dubbing its response 'the best comeback of the day.'

item.title: Justin Timberlake Spreads Positive Vibes With New Song 'Don't Slack' Ft. Anderson .Paak
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The 'Can't Stop the Feeling' hitmaker and his collaborator co-wrote and co-produced the funky song from 'TROLLS World Tour' soundtrack album with Ludwig Goransson.

item.title: Zac Brown Band Call Off Remaining Dates on Spring 2020 Tour Over Coronavirus
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The 'Chicken Fried' hitmakers follow the footsteps of Madonna, Queen, Green Day and BTS in postponing shows and entire tours as precaution to the spread of COVID-19.

item.title: Billie Eilish's 'Bad Guy' Outshines Lil Nas X's 'Old Town Road' as Global Single of 2019
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Frances Moore, the CEO of the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry, praises the 18-year-old hitmaker for taking the world by storm with her incredible voice and genre-defying sound.

item.title: Sheryl Crow Bands Together With Brothers Osborne to Raise $500,000 for Nashville Tornado Relief
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The 'To Nashville, With Love' benefit concert also sees performances by Brandi Carlile, Ashley McBryde, Yola, Old Crow Medicine Show, Margo Price and The Black Keys rocker Dan Auerbach.

item.title: Chester Bennington's Widow Brings 320 Festival to Los Angeles for Change in Mental Health Culture
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Talinda Bennington-Friedman, whose Linkin Park frontman husband died of suicide in 2017, wants to further normalize mental health conversations and provide resources for those in need.

item.title: Ozzy Osbourne Gets Emotional in 'Ordinary Man' Music Video
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The visuals sees the former Black Sabbath frontman looking at footage from his life that includes home videos of his family and the all-terrain vehicle accident.

item.title: Coachella and Stagecoach Officially Pushed Back to October Amid Coronavirus Concerns
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Stressing the importance of guests, staff and community's health and safety at a time of universal uncertainty, promoters at Goldenvoice claim they will honor all purchases for the April dates.

item.title: Billie Eilish Strips Off During Tour to Hit Back at Body-Shamers
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: In an interlude between songs, audience members are shown a clip of the Grammy-winning singer slowly removing her shirt to eventually stand in just her bra.

item.title: Coachella Festival to be Rescheduled Due to Coronavirus Outbreak
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.category: Rage Against the Machine;Frank Ocean;Travis Scott
item.description: The annual music and arts festival, which will feature Rage Against the Machine, Frank Ocean and Travis Scott among others this year, is initially set to be held over two weekends in April.

item.title: Meek Mill Slammed for Pulling Out of Massachusetts Concert Due to Small Crowd
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The 'Tupac Back' rapper allegedly leaves audiences at the University of Massachusetts Mullen Center hanging as he refuses to perform because there are less than 2,000 people in attendance.

item.title: Richard Marx 'Super Bummed' Having to Delay Sold-Out European Tour Over Coronavirus
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: In a candid video message posted on his Instagram page, the 'Right Here Waiting' singer explains that he and his team did not make the decision to reschedule lightly.

item.title: Eminem Gets High and Punched by Mike Tyson in 'Godzilla' Music Video
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The trippy clip, which sees the 'Lose Yourself' hitmaker having a series of bizarre hallucinations, also features Dr. Dre and a tribute to late rapper Juice WRLD.

item.title: Neil Diamond Gets Standing Ovation for Stage Return Two Years After Retirement
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Having stepped away from music due to Parkinson's disease, the 'Sweet Caroline' hitmaker performs a number of his greatest hits at the Keep Memory Alive Power of Love gala in Las Vegas.

item.title: Led Zeppelin Acquitted of Copyright Infringement in 'Stairway to Heaven' Case
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Michael Skidmore has been seeking royalties from Jimmy Page and Robert Plant since 2014, accusing them of infringing Spirit's 'Taurus' to create their rock anthem.

item.title: Madonna Forced to Axe Two Madame X Dates in Paris Over Coronavirus Lockdown
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The spread of COVID-19 has also affected a number of events in the U.S. with the cancellation of the SXSW Festival in Austin, Texas as well as Ultra Music Festival in Miami.

item.title: Gwen Stefani Joins 'Best Friend' Blake Shelton for Surprise Duet at His L.A. Concert
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The 'Hollaback Girl' songstress delights audience at the Forum in Los Angeles when she makes an appearance during the 'God's Country' singer's concert to perform their collaboration 'Nobody But You'.

item.title: Lil Baby Nabs First No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 With 'My Turn'
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Also making history this week is Bad Bunny's 'YHLQMDLG' that debuts at No. 2, marking the highest-charting all-Spanish-language album ever on the Billboard 200 chart.

item.title: Artist of the Week: BTS
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Not only depending on their luck, this seven-piece group from South Korea has a lot more to show in terms of musicality and performance with their fourth Korean-language studio album 'Map of the Soul: 7'.

item.title: Justin Bieber Relocates a Number of 'Changes' Tour Stops to Smaller Venues
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: The 'Yummy' hitmaker has yet to make any comment on the move, but shows in Texas, Ohio and Michigan are some that have been downgraded from stadiums to arenas.

item.title: Lil Baby's Alabama Show Spoiled by Gunshots, One Hospitalized
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Police are investigating the incident that took place on Saturday night, March 7, when the 'Drip Too Hard' rapper was performing at the Bill Harris Arena in Birmingham.

item.title: Soul II Soul Become Fourth Act Receiving Music Walk of Fame Honor
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Representing his dance group at the unveiling of their stone on the monument site in London, DJ Jazzie B admits that he is 'really proud and slightly overwhelmed.'

item.title: Queen, Whitesnake and Slipknot Pull Out of Shows Over Coronavirus Concerns
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Queen are working out with promoter to reschedule their May concert in Paris, while Whitesnake postpone their Japan tour and Slipknot back out of their entire upcoming Asian tour.

item.title: Christina Aguilera's New 'Mulan' Soundtrack 'Loyal Brave True' Stresses 'Vulnerability and Strength'
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Speaking of her return to her Disney roots 22 years after singing 'Reflection' for the 1998 original movie, the 'Dirrty' songstress tweets, ' 'Mulan has been such a special part of my life and this is a beautiful continuation of the legacy.'

item.title: Old Dominion Blames Coronavirus for Them Backing Out of 2020 C2C Music Festival
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: In their released statement, the country group announce that they will not fly to the U.K. and Ireland for the three-venue festival, claiming that the safety of their team is their top priority.

item.title: Tool Fans Warned of Exposure to Coronavirus at New Zealand Concert
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: An audience member from one of the 'Schism' rock band's gigs in the country has been diagnosed with the illness, making him the nation's fourth case of the virus.

item.title: Chris Martin, Madison Beer Among Stars to Perform at Lovr Benefit Concert
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Being held to advocate for an end to DUI, this first annual music event in memory of the tragically-killed singer LOVR will take place at the Hollywood Palladium in California on March 21.

item.title: Perrie Edwards Forced to Be Absent From Little Mix's Concert in Brazil
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: Expressing her heartbreak for not being able to perform with her bandmates in Sao Paulo, the 26-year-old pop star explains that she has been struck down by an illness.

item.title: The Weeknd Stays Atop U.K. Singles Chart for the Fifth Week With 'Blinding Lights'
item.dc:creator: AceShowbiz.com
item.description: One week after being toppled down by Billie Eilish's James Bond theme 'No Time to Die', the second single from the 'Starboy' singer's 'After Hours' returns to the number one spot.
